forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 12 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening drapes its cool cloak over Downtown San Francisco, the city finds itself wrapped in a gentle veil of clouds. With a low lingering around the comfortable 54 degrees, the west southwest winds whisper through the streets, weaving together the scents of the bay and hints of salt from the ocean breeze. Though the horizon hints at a golden glow, a marine layer holds its presence, suggesting that the familiar fog may still linger at the edges, softening the silhouettes of the iconic skyline and the elegant arches of the Golden Gate Bridge. 

Looking ahead to tomorrow, the promise of a mostly sunny day greets us, with temperatures awakening to a high near 64, easing back into the pleasant embrace of 61 by afternoon. The winds will continue to dance a lively jig, gusting as they sweep through the avenues, adding a dash of energy to the morning bustle. In this atmospheric mosaic, where clouds waltz with sunshine, a light jacket layered over a comfortable shirt will serve you well as you venture out to savor the local cafés or stroll through the tranquil parks. Engage with the city's nuanced rhythm; perhaps it’s a perfect moment to linger over a book at a café or take a leisurely walk along the waterfront, absorbing the unique atmosphere that San Francisco offers during this transitional season.
